top_comment.text:
Nice video guys...a 50 something Amel ?? Looks like good times...We are 
"hunckering" down for some really cold mid-winter weather here in coastal 
Virginia  ﻿
top_comment.author: jstringer213

comments.text:
+Brian SV Delos How did you get enough money to afford the boat? Was it a 
lot of hard work? I assume you all bought shares of the boat or 
something...?
comments.author: alasdair geddes

comments.text:
Thanks for watching!  Delos is a Amel Super Maramu, 53' built in year 
2000.  She's an awesome cruising boat! 

No worries, the days are getting longer and the sun will be shinning soon!
comments.author: SV Delos Crew

captions.text:
We had recently said good-bye
to Cairns

and started our 1300 mile
journey to Darwin.

Which would be our last stop
before getting to Indonesia.
Our first was Lizard Island

Where we enjoyed a beautiful
anchorage, celebrated the 4th
of July,

explored the island and did
some sweet diving.

Our next stop was to be
Margaret Bay.

The conditons over there were
perfect, and we put the poles
out
for some down-wind sailing.

We reached Margaret Bay a few
days later with only one other
boat in site.

The perfect for the first taste
test
of our home made vodka!

"Ohh, that's..."
"Oh!"

"Oh yeah! It taste's just like.."
"Bloody Mary"
"Good job boys!"

"I just bent my nails, so they're standing the other way!"
"OW!"

"That was a f * * *ing frecky
moment"

I put up some flags of all the
countries Delos had visited

And the guys went hunting for
oysters!

Feeling stoked when they came
with a massive bucket full!

Only to be pretty shamed when
they couldn't even open them!

Returning the oysters back to
their home, they resorted back
to making more liquor!
"Oh yeah!"
"That is beautiful!"
The next day,

we took the dingy for a little
adventure.

We had heard of this thing
called the "blue trial"..

starting somewhere in this
massive bay. The only guide was
to look for something.. blue!

"To the beach!"
"To the blue trial!"
(Makes whipping noise)

"We found some blue rope"
"BLUE TRIAL"

"We found some blue rope"
"BLUE TRIAL"

"I see blue rope.. I see blue
rope in that tree.. another one"

"And a blue crate, so we're
off!"

"Looking for the blue trial and
crocks"

The trial was actually really
cool!

We weren't exactly sure where
we were going, but we guessed
over to the wind-ward side of
island

where apparently a lot of blue
debris washed up

and someone a long time ago had
made a sweet little trial out
of it all

"Strange.." 
"That's a weird one"
"Snoopy.."

When we made it to the other
side,

there was pretty sweet hut with
a lot of random stuff
"We made it!"

"Do you wanna leave the other
one Bri?"

"Yeah, we'll leave the blue one
on the trial.. I reckon"

After some lunch, we made our
way back to Delos

and that evening, both us and
Tina decided the wind was
perfect
to continue north.
"Narly waves man"

"What's going on Josje-Rama?" 
"It's Cape York!"

"The tip!" 
"The tip of Australia mate!"

"That speck right there" 
"There we are"

After a while at sea, we
decided to round the cape, and
tuck into Seisa.

A small town, with a
supermarket and a yacht club.
Brady and I decided

to put up the new Delos logo on
the bow

Brian's week of Princess was
almost up. After his final
request, we asked him how it
was.

"Well I got called 'My Lord' a
lot which was nice"
(laughs)

"And we're about ready to pick
this new weeks Prince/Princess"

"Out of the Kava bowl" 
"The new Prince-ss of the week!"
"drum roll please.."
(Drum noises)

"Josje-Rama!" 
"Ohhhh!!"
"Oh yeah!"

And that was it! After a quick
stop at the ridiculously
expensive supermarket,

we were eager to continue on,
excited for the next adventures
to come!
Stay tuned!

As Delos sails over 400 miles
across the Gulf of Carpentaria.
Through isolated and stunning
groups of islands

,pristine beaches, and we even
meet the Australian army
